pageContext.claim: “The United States is, right now, ranked by far No. 1 in the world for preparedness.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump was referring to the Global Health Security Index, which the Johns Hopkins Center for Health Security first issued in October. The university responded to Trump’s call-out during a February 26 news conference by posting this statement: “Though the U.S. does sit atop the rankings, overall the report — produced by the Johns Hopkins Center for Health Security at the university’s Bloomberg School of Public Health, the Nuclear Threat Initiative and the Economist Intelligence Unit — paints a discouraging picture of global readiness. ‘National health security is fundamentally weak around the world,’ the 324-page report concludes. ‘No country is fully prepared for epidemics or pandemics, and every country has important gaps to address.’ ”
